channel.title: Consciousness on The Approximate Mind
channel.description: Recent content in Consciousness on The Approximate Mind

item.title: The Approximate Mind, Part 1: How AI Is Getting Closer to Understanding
item.description: Can machines understand? Not in some distant future, but now. Not perfectly, but approximately. Not by achieving consciousness, but by approximating the functional patterns of human understanding well enough to matter.

item.title: The Approximate Mind, Part 5: What Will AI Eventually Feel?
item.description:
Throughout this series, I’ve carefully skirted a question. I’ve discussed functional understanding, confidence calibration, context-awareness. But I’ve added disclaimers: “AI doesn’t have phenomenal consciousness,” “It doesn’t feel uncertainty.”

These aren’t evasions, they’re honest acknowledgments of what we don’t know. But they leave hanging the question many people actually care about:
